Author: h34t
Content: He used a dramatic title to bring attention to an issue which he believes (1) is important and (2) can only be fixed if a lot of people become aware of it. He explains this clearly, honestly, and without apology.

Author: Tichy
Content: Any pointers? I have considered creating games in JavaScript (OK, arguably my boobs memory is a game in JavaScript), but I still would not consider it the obvious choice for action games. For a beginner, I would rather suggest something classical, where you have a screen/bitmap/whatever that you can draw to?

Title: Is a free global WiFi network possible?

Author: motoko
Content:
Not true. The idea that a startup is more financially secure than a job is not realistic for most people.

At a startup, the worst you can do is lose all your invested capital, go deeply into debt, lose the respect of your peers, burn out, and have such a large gap in your track record of gainful employment that getting a job at the level you would want is very difficult.

Further, you _can_ get fired from a startup. Your investors become your owners, and they can fire you. Your cofounders can fire you (or screw you in other ways), too.

Author: davidw
Content:
You need something with a decent sandbox.

easy access to low level stuff + convenient contact list + bad sandbox model = virus storm, if you're not careful.

Author: jgrahamc
Title: Ask News.YC: where can I find a good Javascript/AJAX/web designer to do outsource work?
Content: Here's my problem: I'm working in a European company that's having a hard time getting a really good Javascript/AJAX person to come in and help us design a new part of our web site.  Where can I find someone (geography is irrelevant to me if they are good)?  Any recommendations?
